    • Method Detail

      • depthFirst

        public static <V extends Node<V>> TraversalStatus<V> depthFirst(V start,
                                                                BiFunction<V,TraversalStatus<V>,Boolean> consumer,
                                                                BiFunction<V,TraversalStatus<V>,Boolean> afterChildConsumer,
                                                                TraversalFlags flags)
        Traverses the graph starting at the start node and using a depth first algorithm. Each node will only be consumed once. The consumer function is applied for each visited node and must return True, if the traversal should continue. If the directed flag is set to true, only outgoing edges are used for traversal from one one to the other, otherwise, incoming edges are used too.
        Type Parameters:
        V -
        Parameters:
        start - the start node
        consumer - The consumer function. The function must return true, if the traversal should continue, otherwise false
        flags - Sets some flags for traversal behaviour
        Returns:
        The traversal status

      • depthFirst

        public static <V extends Node<V>> TraversalStatus<V> depthFirst(V start,
                                                                BiFunction<V,TraversalStatus<V>,Boolean> consumer,
                                                                TraversalFlags flags)

      • depthFirst

        public static <V extends Node<V>> TraversalStatus<V> depthFirst(V start,
                                                                BiFunction<V,TraversalStatus<V>,Boolean> consumer)
        Same as depthFirst(Node, BiFunction, TraversalFlags) but sets the continueOnError parameter to true and directed parameter to true.

      • breadthFirst

        public static <V extends Node<V>> TraversalStatus<V> breadthFirst(V start,
                                                                  BiFunction<V,TraversalStatus<V>,Boolean> consumer,
                                                                  TraversalFlags flags)
        Traverses the graph starting at the start node and using a breadth first algorithm. Each node will only be consumed once. The consumer function is applied for each visited node and must return True, if the traversal should continue. If the directed flag is set to true, only outgoing edges are used for traversal from one one to the other, otherwise, incoming edges are used too. This breadth first algorithm is not able to detect cycles, in a directed graph. Only in undirected.
        Type Parameters:
        V -
        Parameters:
        start - the start node
        consumer - The consumer function. The function must return true, if the traversal should continue, otherwise false
        flags - flags that control traversal behaviour
        Returns:
        The traversal status

      • breadthFirst

        public static <V extends Node<V>> TraversalStatus<V> breadthFirst(V start,
                                                                  BiFunction<V,TraversalStatus<V>,Boolean> consumer)
        Same as breadthFirst(Node, BiFunction, TraversalFlags) but sets continueOnError to true and directed to true.

      • hasCycle

        public static <V extends Node<V>> boolean hasCycle(V startNode)
        Traverses the graph, stops and returns true if it founds a cycle, otherwise returns false
        Type Parameters:
        V -
        Parameters:
        startNode - the start node where the traversal starts
        Returns:
        true, if a cycle was found, otherwise false

      • findFirstCycleNode

        public static <V extends Node<V>> V findFirstCycleNode(V startNode)
        Traverses the graph and if a cycle was detected returns the node where the cycle was detected. Otherwise returns null
        Type Parameters:
        V -
        Parameters:
        startNode - the start node, where the traversal starts
        Returns:
        the node, where the cycle was detected, otherwise null

      • findAllCycleNodes

        public static <V extends Node<V>> List<V> findAllCycleNodes(V startNode)
        Traverses the graph and if a cycle was detected returns the node where the cycle was detected. Otherwise returns null
        Type Parameters:
        V -
        Parameters:
        startNode - the start node, where the traversal starts
        Returns:
        the node, where the cycle was detected, otherwise null

      • topologialSort

        public static <V extends Node<V>> List<V> topologialSort(V startNode)
        Sorts the graph starting at the startNode in topological order. That means for a given path the deepest nodes are before their ancestors. For nodes of the same level the order is the order of the edges on the source node.
        Type Parameters:
        V -
        Parameters:
        startNode - the node where the traversal will start
        Returns:
        A list of sorted nodes
